message.content:
Sure, I can guide you through creating such a plot using matplotlib library in Python. Here is an example assuming your DataFrame is named `df` and the columns are named 'column1' and 'column2':

```python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Assuming df is your dataframe, column1 and column2 are your columns
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 6)) # Adjust the figure size if needed
df['column1'].plot()
df['column2'].plot()
plt.legend(['Column1', 'Column2']) # Add a legend to distinguish between two lines
plt.title('Comparison of Column1 and Column2') # Set title for your plot
plt.xlabel('Index') # Label x-axis
plt.ylabel('Value') # Label y-axis
plt.grid(True) # Add gridlines to the plot
plt.show()
```
This will create a line graph comparing 'column1' and 'column2'. You can adjust this code according to your needs, such as changing colors or adding more features like markers for each point etc.
